intro: Tetracera hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy tetracera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. Tetracera hirsuta typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
